data.title: Colorado School of Mines Athletics
data.meta_description: Emily Garnier (3) D  - 2017: Captain ... D2CCA First-Team All-America ... United Soccer Coaches Third-Team All-America ... D2CCA First-Team All-Region ... United
data.text:
2017: Captain ... D2CCA First-Team All-America ... United Soccer Coaches Third-Team All-America ... D2CCA First-Team All-Region ... United Soccer Coaches First-Team All-Region ... CoSIDA Academic All-District ... United Soccer Coaches Scholar All-West Region Team ... RMAC Defensive Player of the Year ... Team captain ... RMAC Preseason Player and Defensive Player of the Year ... Preseason All-RMAC ... RMAC Defensive Player of the Week (Oct. 3 and Oct. 31) ... RMAC First-Team All-Academic ... Started all 22 games at center back … Led NCAA Division II with 15 assists, a Mines single-season record … Graduated second all-time with 30 career assists … Also scored a goal against CSU-Pueblo … Played 1,948 minutes, most of any Mines outfield player and only a half short of the full season … At one point had an eight-game assist streak including multiple creations against Black Hills State and Fort Lewis … Took 25 shots in all … Anchored a backline that ranked 12th nationally in GAA (.54) and 14th in shutout percentage (.591).

2016: Team captain ... Colorado Sportswoman of the Year in college soccer ... Mines' Female Athlete of the Year Blaster Award recipient ... D2CCA First-Team All-America ... NSCAA Second-Team All-America ... NSCAA First-Team Scholar All-America ... NSCAA First-Team All-Region ... D2CCA South Central Regional Player of the Year ... D2CCA First-Team All-Region ... RMAC Player of the Year and Defensive Player of the Year, only the second student-athlete in RMAC history to win both ... First-Team All-RMAC ... CoSIDA Academic All-District ... RMAC Preseason Defensive Player of the Year ... Preseason All-RMAC ... RMAC First-Team All-Academic ... RMAC Defensive Player of the Week (9/20, 11/1) ... Started all 24 games ... Was the team leader in minutes at 2,196 ... Led Mines with 26 points on eight goals and a team-high 10 assists ... Her 10 assists rank third-best in a season at Mines ... Ended the season fourth on the Mines career assists list (15) ... Went 3-for-3 from the penalty spot ... Scored four times on free kicks ... Scored the game-winner against West Texas A&M ... Also scored against Cal State San Bernardino, New Mexico Highlands, a late equalizer at Regis, against Black Hills State, and twice on free kicks at Adams State to help clinch the RMAC regular-season title ... Scored a free kick against #1 Western Washington in the NCAA quarterfinals ... Had three assists in the postseason, with one in the RMAC Tournament final against CSU-Pueblo and two (including on the overtime golden goal) against Texas A&M-Commerce in the NCAA South Central Regional final.

2015: D2CCA Honorable Mention All-America … NSCAA and D2CCA First-Team All-Region … RMAC Defensive Player of the Year … RMAC Preseason Co-Defensive Player of the Year … First-Team All-RMAC … RMAC All-Tournament team … RMAC Academic Honor Roll member … RMAC Defensive Player of the Week (Nov. 3) … Mines SAAC Athlete of the Month (November) … Started all 22 games at center back … Scored twice from the penalty spot, versus UCCS and Colorado Christian (both game-winning goals) … Took 21 shots … Was Mines’ top choice taker for set pieces and corners … Part of a starting backline that limited opponents to 0.67 goals and 8.5 shots per game.

2014: Started 22 of 24 matches...Led Mines and ranked fifth in RMAC with four assists...Had one goal and seven of nine tries on net...Scored overtime game-winner in 1-0 upset at No. 4 St. Edward’s (9/13)...Set up decisive goal against SEU in second round of NCAA postseason on Nov. 16...Braced back third to Division II lead in shutouts (18) and shutout percentage (.750), and No. 2 in GAA (.274)...NSCAA Second Team All-South Central Region...Honorable Mention All-RMAC...NCAA Division II and RMAC All-Tournament Team...RMAC Defensive Player of the Week (9/16).
